intro: Linaria ramburei, commonly known as the Sierra Madre linaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Linaria ramburei is known for its compact growth habit and is often found in open, sunny areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
